meanings.definition: To clean or dry something by rubbing its surface with a cloth or one's hand.
meanings.sent1: She wiped the table after dinner.
meanings.sent2: I wiped my hands on a towel after washing them.
meanings.sent3: The cat wiped its paws on the doormat before entering.
meanings.sent4: The wind wiped away all footprints in the sand.
meanings.sent5: He wiped the spill with a napkin, leaving no trace behind.

meanings.definition: To remove or eliminate something completely.
meanings.sent1: He wiped out all the cookies from the jar.
meanings.sent2: The storm wiped away the sandcastle on the beach.
meanings.sent3: The magician wiped the rabbit out of the hat.
meanings.sent4: The flood wiped out the entire village.
meanings.sent5: She wiped the drawing from the whiteboard with a sponge.

meanings.definition: To erase or remove data from a computer or electronic device.
meanings.sent1: She wiped the files from the hard drive.
meanings.sent2: He wiped the memory card before selling it.
meanings.sent3: The virus wiped all the important documents from the computer.
meanings.sent4: The hacker wiped out all the data on the server.
meanings.sent5: The technician wiped the virus from the system, restoring it to normal.
